title: TEMPLATE_OVERLAY
description: A concrete form of the bare `ARCHETYPE` class, used to represent overlays in a source template. Overlays have no meta-data of their own, and are instead documented by their owning template.
$comments: Defined in Aom2 IM, inherits from ARCHETYPE

parent_archetype_id.description: Archetype reference of the specialisation par-ent of this archetype, if applicable. May take the form of an archetype interface identifier, i.e. the identifier up to the major version only, or can be deeper.

is_differential.description: Flag indicating whether this archetype is differential or flat in its contents. Top-level source archetypes have this flag set to True.

definition.description: Root node of the definition of this archetype.

rules.description: Rules relating to this archetype. Statements are expressed in first order predicate logic, and usually refer to at least two attributes.

concept_code.description: The concept code of the root object of the archetype, also standing for the concept of the archetype as a whole.

physical_paths.description: Set of language-independent paths extracted from archetype. Paths obey Xpath-like syntax and are formed from alternations of `C_OBJECT._node_id_` and `C_ATTRIBUTE._rm_attribute_name_` values.

logical_paths.description: Set of language-dependent paths extracted from archetype. Paths obey the same syntax as physical_paths, but with node_ids replaced by their meanings from the ontology.

specialisation_depth.description: Specialisation depth of this archetype; larger than 0 if this archetype has a parent. Derived from terminology.specialisation_depth.

is_specialised.description: True if this archetype is a specialisation of another.
